newsitem.title: FRANCE: EMU can't ignore social conditions-French minister.
newsitem.headline: EMU can't ignore social conditions-French minister.

text.p: Foreign Minister Hubert Vedrine, echoing campaign statements by Prime Minister Lionel Jospin, said on Wednesday that the commitment of France's new leftist government to a planned single currency depended on social conditions.

Across Europe, "the commitment to the euro remains dominant. That is also the commitment of this government. It is simply that we do not want to do it ignoring social conditions," Vedrine said in an interview on French radio France Info.
A new leftist government took over in France after sweeping the previous centre-right government from power in a June 1 parliamentary election.

During the parliamentary campaign, Jospin said France should enter into European monetary union only if it met certain conditions, including that it not set back efforts to create jobs and that Italy and Spain participate in a single currency from the start. -- Paris newsroom +33 1 4221 5339
